intro: Herodotia haitiensis, commonly known as Haitian herodotia, is a flowering plant native to Haiti. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pink to reddish flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to the tropical climate of the Caribbean. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
